definition: the end/to conclude
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
exit door (of the stage)

sentences.english: The subject for discussion was the future of Rommel and his Africa Corps.
sentences.chinese: 討論的題目是隆美爾及其非州軍團的下場。

sentences.english: End of Nanjing has a team vs. Chongchao popular Chengdu Sheffield United.
sentences.chinese: 下場南京有有隊將主場迎戰衝超熱門的成都謝菲聯隊。

sentences.english: Capello substituted him fearing a red card would follow.
sentences.chinese: 卡佩羅擔心維拉喫紅牌就把他換下場。

sentences.english: Syme's fate was not difficult to foresee.
sentences.chinese: 賽麥的下場是不難預見的。

sentences.english: Bad people always come to a sticky end.
Betray a friend, and you'll often find you have ruined yourself.
sentences.chinese: 背叛朋友，你也不會有好下場。

sentences.english: Imagine the next game — I could have a heart problem.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下下場比賽，我可能就有心臟病了。

sentences.english: A saturating rain was expected to end the drought.
sentences.chinese: 只盼下場透雨，解除旱情。

sentences.english: A basketball player is allowed five personal fouls before fouling out.
sentences.chinese: 籃球運動員侵人犯規五次即被罰下場。

sentences.english: Severe consequences happen to those who trust in the frailty of people.
sentences.chinese: 那些將信任放在軟弱人身上的人，會有嚴重的下場。

sentences.english: The fullback got benched with injuries.
John the Baptist was faithful, but he was beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 施洗約翰也盡忠，下場卻是被斬首。

sentences.english: The fullback was benched with injuries.
It is because of her that I am here today.
sentences.chinese: 就是因爲她我才落個今天這樣的下場。

sentences.english: That's what she gets for eating my roast beef sandwich.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，這就是你偷喫我的燒牛肉三明治的下場。

sentences.english: Ferdinand left the field ahead of time during Saturday's Man Utd match against Watford.
sentences.chinese: 費迪南德在週六曼聯與沃特福德的比賽中提前下場。

definition: not necessarily/not likely
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
as before/(same) as usual/in the same manner/still/nevertheless
miserable/wretched/cruel/inhuman/disastrous/tragic/dim/gloomy
like this/this way
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
penalty/punishment/to punish
situation (of a person)
vile/nasty/of very poor quality
should not/to owe nothing
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
tragedy/CL:齣|出[chu1]
